author: Staff Reporter
text:
Masi Kodai festival at Mandaikadu Bhagavathi Amman Temple near Colachel in Kanyakumari district began with the traditional flag hoisting on Sunday.

Thousands of devotees from across Kanyakumari, Tirunelveli and Thoothukudi districts and Kerala witnessed the flag hosting ceremony led by ‘tantri’ Edakkode Mahadeva Iyer and Mel Shanti Sattanatha Kurukkal. The Kodai festival is the most important event at the temple.

Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation and Kerala State Road Transport Corporation operated special buses to the temple from various destinations.

Union Minister of State for Road Transport, Highways and Shipping Pon. Radhakrishnan was the chief guest. Kanyakumari MLA K.T. Pachaimal, former MLA Velayutham and BJP senior leader M.R. Gandhi participated.

Joint Commissioner of HR and CE Department (Madurai and Tirunelveli) and Special Officer for Masi Kodai festival Pachaiappan, Joint Commissioner for Kanyakumari district R. Pon Swaminathan, Superintendent of Padmanabhapuram Dawasom Area S. Jeevanantham and temple manager Arumuga Saran were present.

title: Masi Kodai festival begins at temple
